text: and i think what really excels here is
that pollumi and cdk shine when you're
using typescript i think it's such a
great language for infrastructure as
code because it's strictly typed you can
have interfaces that you can define for
the different properties that you need
to get out to expose output variables
you're just using export keywords like
all of these things just typescript is
great i think if you haven't tried to do
any infrastructures code using
typescript with cdk or bloomy you should
just go try it it's so cool and the way
that the node ecosystem and typescript
allows you to pass functions around or
you know the first class they can be
exported they can be renamed they can be
bound they can be higher order you can
pass function within the functions yeah
the flexibility there is phenomenal so i
encourage everyone to try typescript
first before going to any of the other
languages
but not you you're go right i i do most
of my preliminary typescript i have
started doing it in go and i just yeah
it's not as nice the error checking all

polymerical and i just stick to
